se.code77.jq

Class Value<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.code77.jq.Value<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of the value being wrapped
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Future<V>

    public final class Value<V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Future<V>
    A simple wrapped value implementing the Future interface. The value is immediately available through the Future.get() method, and the Future is always considered to be "done". Since the value is avaialable already when creating the object, canceling is not applicable.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Value.VoidCallable
      A wrapper for calling void methods and returning Value.VOID.

      • wrap

        public static <V> Value<V> wrap(V value)
        Wrap the given value
        Type Parameters:

        value - The value
        Returns:
        The wrapped value

      • wrap

        public static Value<java.lang.Void> wrap(Value.VoidCallable callable)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Convenience for calling a void method and returning a Future<Void>. Examples: 
             return Value.wrap(this::doSomething);

     return Value.wrap(() -> doSomethingWithArgs(42));
        Parameters:
        callable - The callback making the call to a void method
        Returns:
        Value.VOID
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the invoked void method threw an exception

      • get

        public final V get()
        Returns the wrapped value. Will never block since the value is already available upon construction

      • get

        public V get(long timeout,
             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the wrapped value. Will never block nor cause any timeout, since the value is already available upon construction
